channel.title: R on data %>% hack
channel.description: Recent content in R on data %>% hack

item.title: Is This Good for the Company?
item.description: In this post I’m going to build a text classification model using the script from The Office. I’ll use the R package dundermifflin to access the quote data I’ll need to build the classification model as well as various packages from tidymodels and the tidyverse for data wrangling, data visualization, model fitting and evaluation, and prediction. First, let’s load the packages we’ll need and explore the data a bit:

item.title: Welcome! (Yes, I know where you are)
item.description: It seems appropriate for my first post to be about all the creepy things I can find out about my readers using Google Analytics, as it will give you a chance to quickly leave if you don’t want me to know your deep, dark secrets. For those of you with no intention of using google analytics or interest in the code in this post, you may still find the following details interesting, as there seems to be a general misunderstanding, at least among members of Congress, about what information is collected from internet users and who can access it:
